If `path` is a symlink to a regular file, this will silently fail and do nothing.

I would use

```scala
if (!Files.isDirectory(path.toNIO)) {
  Files.createDirectories(path.toNIO)
}
```

instead
To elaborate, using `isDirectory` in that scenario will allow `createDirectories` to fail with a meaningful error, instead of silently ignoring the issue.
Good catch! I updated the logic to run `createDirectories` on the dealiased path. If the symlink points to a file it should fail with the correct message in that case.
I would return the `AbsolutePath` for consistency with the Java API.
